metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20406 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Modules/_pickle.c in Python before 3.7.1 has an integer overflow via alarge LONG_BINPUT value that is mishandled during a "resize to twice thesize" attempt. This issue might cause memory exhaustion, but is onlyrelevant if the pickle format is used for serializing tens or hundreds ofgigabytes of data. This issue is fixed in: v3.4.10, v3.4.10rc1; v3.5.10,v3.5.10rc1, v3.5.7, v3.5.7rc1, v3.5.8, v3.5.8rc1, v3.5.8rc2, v3.5.9;v3.6.10, v3.6.10rc1, v3.6.11, v3.6.11rc1, v3.6.12, v3.6.7, v3.6.7rc1,v3.6.7rc2, v3.6.8, v3.6.8rc1, v3.6.9, v3.6.9rc1; v3.7.1, v3.7.1rc1,v3.7.1rc2, v3.7.2, v3.7.2rc1, v3.7.3, v3.7.3rc1, v3.7.4, v3.7.4rc1,v3.7.4rc2, v3.7.5, v3.7.5rc1, v3.7.6, v3.7.6rc1, v3.7.7, v3.7.7rc1, v3.7.8,v3.7.8rc1, v3.7.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5').
python3.4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm2').
python3.5 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
